alert.note: Alert for Christian (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 3:01AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Kentucky, including the following county, Christian. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area, with localized higher totals possible. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hopkinsville, Oak Grove, Fort Campbell, Clarksville, Pembroke, Crofton, Lafayette and Herndon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
